extendedInfo.description: drchrono is certified as a complete EHR (Electronic Health Record) in accordance with ONC-ATCB stage 1 Meaningful Use criteria. Our free platform qualifies you for Meaningful Use EHR incentives under the HITECH Act in the economic stimulus plan. By using our certified app and platform, youâre qualified for $44,000+ in tax incentives.Use a better EHR. Access your EHR from an iPad, iPhone, the web, or an Android device - no contract required. Within minutes of downloading the app, you're ready to use a fully featured and certified EHR. For free. - For every healthcare provider. Now, you can take your practice anywhere, at any time.- Easy to use. Launch the app, and start using the EHR within seconds. - Safe and secure. All industry-standard security practices are met. drchrono is an innovative, point of care solution that enhances the healthcare practice experience. We take care of all of your scheduling, medical billing, and clinical needs. Healthcare providers now a solution that is Meaningful Use certified by the Government. Start achieving Meaningful Use today and receive EHR adoption incentive payments from Medicare and Medicaid. Getting Started: 1) Download the App.2) Create your account.3) Start using it in your practice.***Write to support@drchrono.com with questions or issues.***

reviews.title: Downgrade
reviews.comment: They updated an already minimally useful app that only displays a schedule by now requiring a sign in every time you open the app. I wish I could revert this \"upgrade\"
reviews.author: Fernando Morales

reviews.comment: Needs a lot of work!  Very basic, just the schedule.    It needs to be able to adjust the appointments
reviews.author: Taylor Winn

reviews.title: Perfect app
reviews.comment: This is a patient viewer into drchrono EMR, I use an iPad for my primary device, but when I\'m home I have my Android tab. This app is simple, works and just shows a list of patients coming in.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lame
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t work on my note 2. Don\'t bother down loading until they make it usable.
reviews.author: howie wine

reviews.title: Need Full Features
reviews.comment: Need full features that works with Android just like apple os.
reviews.author: Taylor Taylor

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.comment: The thing I hate the most is that this app is great for a fellow optician\'s iPhone. I literally can do nothing but see the daily appointment list. This app is insulting for android users.
reviews.author: Katy Kummer

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: I work for a small practice. Only one doctor and it was the doctor\'s decision to go paperless with drchrono. The staff is very happy with the choice.  The platform is mainly web and iOS based but this is the light app they built out for android. When our office made suggestions to improve the platform, they took our suggestions and implemented some. Not very many healthcare companies listen to their customers. They did.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useless but ith potential
reviews.comment: Android only supports schedule viewing not documenting.
reviews.author: Tim Pedersen

reviews.comment: Folks, IT IS NOT FREE. You get a demo, not even rightaway, but you will be contacted later with a key! Not so straight forward :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Works great on my Mac, even on my PC. But does absolutely nothing in android form. Won\'t even let me log in
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Schedule View only, not fully functional yet
reviews.comment: It looks like you can only view your appointment schedule on your android phone with this app. You can\'t add a new appointment, and you can\'t enter any notes or information yet. I do get email reminders for my daily schedule. I would love to know if this has full functionality on an android tablet. Also, if you want them to do your billing, it\'s $399/month and you never actually own the software which is a big let down.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Come on :/
reviews.comment: Can\'t you make a useful android app? You surely have enough $ tech power to do better than this, it should equal the ipad version.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not usefull as it is
reviews.comment: After seen this app in an ipad I was very happy to see it in the market. After doing the registration login process, I finally get access. What a disapointment!!! only offer to see the appointment list... functionality is near to none. You can\'t edit anything... not even the list or the patient in the list. Without mentioning the other function available in the ipad that are equal to the PC version. I\'m really sorry, but this isn\'t an app this is a CRapp. Don\'t get me wrong I interested and will get an anual subscription if you make it equal to the ipads version. I will subscribe to your \"Help us build... blah blah\" program to see if this can be improved.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Recently unable to log in! Useless if you can\'t log in. PLEASE FIX ASAP. Uninstall
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Poor. No wonder the only positive reviews so far come from within the company.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Install fails
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Our goal is to make healthcare better for us all. As the CEO of Dr. Chrono I\'m especially proud of this latest release to the Android Marketplace. Paired with our full EHR platform for tablet devices, we are finally breaking down the barriers that everyday doctors face when using Electronic Medical Record technology when treating their patients. Providing these tools directly over the Android Marketplace for direct download helps the everyday doctors that me and my family visit everyday have instant access to an EMR through their mobile device.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool
reviews.comment: After researching what was out there , we decided to with a free EMR , drchrono. We were up and running within a day. It is a free web-based EMR with an android, ipad, iPod touch and iPhone app. The android app is just ok, but the iPad app, WoW. Best of all , the EMR is free !
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: I work for an internal medicine MD who is opening up a new office. I use this app when I am out of the office to see who is coming in. It needs more work to be like the ipad EHR, but is a great addition to the platform.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Recommended
reviews.comment: I like my Android phone and use an IPad and my computer with drchrono, does the job of listing out patients names.
reviews.author: A Google User
